q: Why are no articles coming in and being delivered for my feed?
a:
Double check that D.RSS has permissions to read and send messages.

    Make sure the all feed's contents and articles are publicly accessible (for example, not in private forum sections)
    
    Make sure any feed filters that you set are working as expected.

    Wait at at least 10 minutes for any new articles to be fetched, if there are any past the time of feed addition (which can be checked in a browser that beautifies the feed such as firefox, or a browser plugin).
    
    If still nothing by then, make sure the feed you're trying to add has the pubdate (published date) and `{date}` field in rsstest filled out. If they don't exist, it will be marked as old and won't be sent. You may bypass this by disabling date checks for a specific feed in rssoptions #4.
    
    If date checks are turned on (which is default), make sure articles `{date}` are less than a day old.

q: Why am I getting "(Connection failed) Bad Cloudflare status code (503). Unsupported on public bot"?
a: Support for Cloudflare feeds has been removed on the public bot to reduce fetch timese for the greater good of everyone else.

q: Why am I getting duplicate articles with the same title?
a: The feed author may be improperly formatting the feed, causing two same articles to have the different unique identifiers (commonly guid) and thus classified as different articles. You may work around this by enabling title checks via ~rssoptions.

q: How do I move or add a feed to a channel?
a: Use the rssadd command in your desired channel, or use the rssmove command to move an existing feed to another channel.

q: What is a valid RSS feed, and how do I find one?
a: A valid feed is normally a page with XML code. See https://rss.nytimes.com/services/xml/rss/nyt/HomePage.xml for an example of how an RSS page looks like. To find a feed, you can find an RSS icon or a link that alludes to getting updates. If you are still unable to find it, you can try contacting the site admin to see if they can provide the RSS feed you need.

q: How do I change the default embed?
a: The default embed is auto-generated by Discord. To use your own and replace the default embed, use the ~rssembed command.

q: How do I mention a user when a new article comes in?
a: To mention everyone, put the @everyone mention in ~rssmessage. To mention a specific role or user, use the ~rssmention command for users and roles. **Make sure you use the `{subscriptions}` placeholder since this is where the mentions are located.

q: How do I restore an rssbackup file?
a: If you're on the public bot, DM me your file. Otherwise, use the restore bot controller command.

q: What permissions does someone need to use the bot?
a: Manage Channel permission in either Server Settings, or in a specific channel's settings.

q: How do I get higher feed limit or faster refresh rate?
a:
You may get an official limit increase that supports customizations for each individual feed by supporting me on Patreon https://www.patreon.com/discordrss (would be greatly appreciated!).
    
    You may also use a feed aggregator to combine multiple feeds into one (this has some disadvantages, such as its own unknown refresh time separate from the bot's). The limit is there to prevent abuse, and to optimize retrieval times.

q: How do I give a custom name and avatar to the bot?
a:
For a custom name, you can set its nickname by right click and change nickname.
    
    If you want a custom avatar, this can only be done via webhooks (https://github.com/synzen/Discord.RSS/wiki/Webhook-Integration). For use of webhooks on the public bot, you will need to be a patron (https://www.patreon.com/discordrss).

q: How do I get the content in a tag in the original XML feed source that is not available as a placeholder?
a: Use rssdump to get a list of all possible "raw" placeholders, and refer to them as `{raw:placeholder_name}` in your message or filters. Replace `placeholder_name` with the name in the rssdump file.

q: How do I remove image links from a placeholder?
a: Disable image links existence in rssoptions.

q: How do I add anchors or masked links to my message?
a: Masked links can only be added within embeds, wherever they are allowed. To create them within an embed, use the format: ```[Click Me!](https://www.google.com)``` where you put your text within the square brackets, and the link within the parentheses.

q: How do I get fewer articles delivered, or get slower delivery?
a: To get slower article delivery, you will have to self host and set the refresh rate in config to your needs. To get fewer aticles delivered, you can set filters to only get the content you want delivered.
